content.rendered:
Photo by Unsplash

This Week in Genesis (#29), a new Genesis community effort from Calvin, three awesome new premium themes and some event called WordCamp US?

Let’s go.

New thing from Calvin!

A new place for bloggers to post their work and gain exposure: Genesis Framework on Medium — https://t.co/mb7hRZuSvg #genesiswp

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) December 3, 2015

So, most of you know I feature a lot of stuff from Calvin Koepke on these updates, and deservedly so (the guy just puts out great stuff).

However this week I wanted to give a special shout out to something new he’s doing over on Medium.

But, I’ll let him explain it better than me 🙂

So, I’ve started a new idea: http://www.medium.com/genesis-framework/

I’m sure you get the idea by just looking, but the idea is to build the community up on Medium, and give people an avenue to publish their work and existing posts to a wider audience.

If you’ve got any value at all out of GenesisWP.guide, I definitely encourage you to check it out and support what he is doing over there too.

Themes

No Sidebar is here! That’s right, the often admired, much requested No Sidebar theme from Brian Gardner has arrived and is now available for purchase or download over at StudioPress.

No Sidebar Pro theme now available — https://t.co/C2e3y0i45D #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/zpfLYg9g6v

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) December 2, 2015

Next up Shay Bocks (yes, The Shay Bocks of best selling Genesis theme fame for Foodie Pro) has launched a new theme, entitled Dear. Coded by Rob Neu, the new theme is everything you’d expect from one of the communities favourite premium theme designers.

Check out my friend @shaybocks new, gorgeous theme! https://t.co/YCoNFRCgaH #genesiswp #WordPress

— Lindsey Riel (@lindseyriel) December 1, 2015

Frank over at WPStudio launches a new Genesis theme, Simple.

Little side project. A Simple Genesis theme with featured image slider. Will be released soon! @dribbble https://t.co/neEOvQ5T6X #genesiswp

— WPStudio (@wpstudiowp) December 2, 2015

The folks over at PIXL Designs have wrapped their Exodus theme and will be launching it soon.

Exodus theme is wrapped up! And we are finalizing the last stages of the ChurchPress revamp #genesiswp #almostready pic.twitter.com/RNLbo7XLzT

— PIXL Designs (@pixldesigns) December 3, 2015

Showcase

First up, two new sites from Rebecca Gill, bionicturtle.com

Just launched the new https://t.co/yIxEpJXjYn website using #genesiswp @LearnDashLMS @WooCommerce and WordPress. pic.twitter.com/PtdgbYLwLH

— Rebecca Gill (@rebeccagill) December 2, 2015

…and hitmatics.com.sg

WordPress website launch no. 2 -> https://t.co/ENIvo3ipm1 New logo + custom WordPress theme built on #genesiswp. pic.twitter.com/bk6DHQY756

— Rebecca Gill (@rebeccagill) December 2, 2015

…Cristina Sanz with a nice site for mondayprojects.com

Otro precioso sitio LC. This lovely site is using Marion Theme #genesiswp #webdesign https://t.co/wIpm60xMUw pic.twitter.com/xK1rkw1waa

— Cristina Sanz (@LovelyConfetti) December 2, 2015

…Jamie Mitchell for dynamikfr.com.au

Another awesome #genesiswp site launch and a very happy client. https://t.co/dLKBvxRuIH pic.twitter.com/reqD8RO78l

— Jamie Mitchell (@jamiejmitchell) December 4, 2015

…and, Kathy Osborne for historiclewesfarmersmarket.org

Just launched! https://t.co/cqal3SjM7V – built using @studiopress #genesiswp #farmersmarket #webdesign #website pic.twitter.com/lZD0aE3SBr

— Kathy Osborne (@koartdesign) December 1, 2015

Also, I’m not 100% sure it’s new this week (I should’ve asked but I ran out of time before publishing!) but a special shout out anyway to Shay Bock’s website, shaybocks.com, one of the finest designs I’ve seen on Genesis.

Best of the rest

Calvin (yes, him again) is back with a great explainer, The Genesis Framework Explained and Why I’m Hooked…

The Genesis Framework Explained, and Why I'm Hooked — https://t.co/j2k2OiTeL1 #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/Blb2Sybt2q

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) December 2, 2015

…and a cool tutorial on How to Add a Live Progress Bar to Your Posts in Genesis.

Add a Live Progress Bar to Your Posts in Genesis — https://t.co/zroRkXR4qT #genesiswp

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) December 1, 2015

And if that wasn’t enough, he’s also looking for your ebook ideas.

If I were to write an eBook, what would you want it to be about? #genesiswp

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) December 1, 2015

Sean Vandenberg publishes an interview with leading Genesis developer, Bill Erickson.

@BillErickson – At long last, it's live… thanks again for your time :). https://t.co/TvynD38ONc #genesiswp #WordPress #webdeveloper

— Sean Vandenberg (@sean_vandenberg) November 28, 2015

Sridhar drops some knowledge on how to replace an entry title heading tag for a specific Featured Post widget.

How to replace entry title heading tag for a specific Featured Post widget using GFPC: https://t.co/iKFXaYuZQU #GenesisWP

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) December 3, 2015

Neil Gee shares a tutorial on Adding Multiple Site Background Images to the Agency Pro Theme (by StudioPress).

Add Multiple Site Background Images To #GenesisWP Agency Pro Theme https://t.co/2ZynHCBMQ0

— Neil Gee (@_neilgee) December 2, 2015

Bradley’s up to something 🙂

Building a #genesiswp plugin that adds meta boxes which allow custom HTML to be added to commonly used hooks on per page or post basis.

— Bradley Potter (@bradleypotter) November 28, 2015

Partial screenshot of my latest #genesiswp plugin experiment pic.twitter.com/0eVwwdWmvK

— Bradley Potter (@bradleypotter) November 29, 2015

Latest plugin I'm working on adds WYSIWYG editors to commonly used #genesiswp hooks in the edit page/post admin. Unique content per post.

— Bradley Potter (@bradleypotter) December 2, 2015

If you didn’t get enough over Black Friday / Cyber Monday, there’s a few Genesis related deals still kicking around for you, both expiring this week.

  • 20% off the Flex Pro theme by Simple Pro Themes
  • 20% off anything at Shay Bocks Designs

And, finally…

If you’re going to WordCamp US this weekend then, like Susan, I hope you have a blast.

I hope all my #genesiswp friends have fun at #WCUS this weekend. I'll be there in spirit!!!

— Susan Ramsey (@onehappystudio) December 3, 2015

And, if you missed it, here are the Genesis meetup details for those that are going.

#GenesisWP Meetup #WCUS will be at the Hard Rock Cafe on December 4, from 6pm to 10pm https://t.co/25MXIHVb3o

— Rian Rietveld (@RianRietveld) November 25, 2015

That’s all for this week.

But I’ll be back next week with another action packed update for you. I’m also hoping to have a couple of interviews with a few more leading lights of the Genesis community for you soon so stay tuned for this.

Until then, have a fantastic weekend, enjoy WordCamp US if you’re going and support Calvin 🙂

PS If you dig these weekly updates, you can get occasional updates throughout the week over on Twitter. Plus, if you don’t already, you can subscribe by email so you never miss a post over here.

excerpt.rendered: New Genesis community initiative on Medium from Calvin Koepke, three awesome new premium themes and some event called WordCamp US?
